name: Ambrosia Historic Bed & Breakfast Retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm always a bit apprehensive arriving at a new place but needn't have worried. The house is stunning, totally removated with a modern interior. Gae greeted us warmly and showed us to our room and provided us with a glass of wine and delicous nibbles.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is a feature at Ambrosia and although we had a prompt departure to catch a ferry, Gae and Gavin managed to fit it all the courses and it didn't feel rushed at all.
reviews.title: Wonderful Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was wonderful and like everything else was prepared with an enormous amount of love and care and was delicious!
reviews.title: Fantastic B&B!
Charming, romantic B&B
reviews.text: Staying at Ambrosia is a real treat. Comfortable and welcoming. Just wish we could have stayed an extra night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay at Ambrosia. The breakfasts were amazing, the rooms simple yet luxurious, and Gae and Gavin were ideal hosts, more than able to steer you off the beaten tourist track into the best local places. I've recommended this bed and breakfast to all my friends, and look forward to staying there again.
reviews.title: The Breakfast was fantastic

likes.disliked: — It was a bit of a walk to downtown, but not onerously so

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very relaxing B&B. Very helpful innkeepers. Good local recommendations. Comfortable room. The breakfast is remarkable; a great way to start the day. A good location, easy to walk to the downtown harbor, restaurants, whale watching boats, etc. We would gladly stay here again.
reviews.title: Welcoming staff; wonderful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at Ambrosia and the Zen Room. We have been there in winter and summer and each season has its own appeal. We love the tranquil atmosphere of the room and the giant soaker tub with candles and bath salts. The location is superb, off the main street so we could here the horse drawn carriages in the evening but within a 5 min walking distance to the downtown harbour and the sea walk. The hosts are gracious with just the right amount of friendliness. The breakfasts need to be experienced- words don't do them justice.
reviews.title: The Zen Room is outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Michael and I loved everything about our brief stay in Victoria, especially the Ambrosia Historic Bed & Breakfast Retreat. We had the downstairs suite which included a private bathroom with heated floor tiles and a candle-lit whirlpool bath for two, large comfy bed with extra soft pillows, a fireplace, and a sumptious four-course breakfast that included the most delicious croissants and local berry preserves ever! We enjoyed simulating conversation with the other guests as well as helpful hints about what to see and do in beautiful Victoria. Our hosts Gae and Gavin were gracious and caring. We look forward to future stays at the Ambrosia. It's quite a find.-Evelyn and Michael Bell, Fullerton California
reviews.title: Excellent All Around

likes.liked: — The delicious breakfast and beautiful suite
likes.disliked: — Take a shortcut through the orchards of the old all girl's school. Watch the street performers at the sea wall, and visit the beautiful Butchart Gardens

reviews.text: "Ambrosia" is the nectar of the gods; Ambrosia Bed & Breakfast comes close. At least, it left a sweet taste in our mouths. My 18 year old daughter and I were taking our first trip together without the rest of the family. Although I knew Victoria B.C. was a beautiful city with lots of activities, I remained slightly nervous about what was in store for us, wanting everything to be perfect for my college-bound child on her last vacation trip before school. I shouldn't have worried. Gracious attention from hosts Gavin and Gae made us feel immediately welcome and at home. Their willingness to help us to locate any place we wanted to go, see or do; as well as offering to make reservations and handle other details gave us nothing else to do except delight in our visit. We loved the delicious truffles left on our pillows, the constant supply of water which magically appeared in our personal mini-fridge, the coffee table outside our door with a plate of fresh baked cookies that never seemed to empty (no matter how many we ate.) We slept soundly in a comfortable bed and, surprisingly, had no awareness of other guests until we met them at breakfast. We enjoyed breakfast tremendously; the food was fabulous, and the company at the table provided interesting and intelligent conversation. My daughter had a wonderful last trip before she starts college, and I'll have some great memories to sustain me in my loneliness until she comes home for Christmas. We had an excellent time. Thank you Gavin and Gae
reviews.title: Ambrosia is well-named

likes.liked: — The wonderful four course breakfast, terrific hosts

reviews.title: A perfect place for a honeymoon
reviews.text: I can't say enough about this place. You will be delighted in every way, and Gavin and Gae are absolutely fabulous. We were only there for 4 days, but it was great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went for an anniversary weekend and were blown away by the hosts (Gae & Gavin), the ammenities and the 4 course breakfasts. It was a surprise for my wife and Gae and Gavin went above and beyond with helping arrange the weekend full of surprises for her. In our next visit to Victoria, B.C. we will definately be staying at the Ambrosia Bed & Breakfast. Thanks again! A+++++++
reviews.title: Superb weekend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a week in the Pacific Northwest. We topped off our trip with a stay in Victoria, B.C., just for a night. We wish we could have stayed longer, especially to enjoy the relaxation at the Ambrosia B&B. Our hosts were there to greet us and show us our room, but also gave us the space we needed as guests. Gavin even offered to make dinner reservations for us at local restaurants. The B&B is a charming Victorian and we enjoyed all the detail that was put into making this place a home away from home. Our suite-The Isis-had a whirlpool tub that beat the jacuzzi at the Westin in Seattle! The four course breakfast is no joke-truly fabulous food in an inviting setting. We would visit the Ambrosia again and recommend it to anyone looking to stay in Victoria.
reviews.title: Peaceful and Charming

reviews.text: We were so fortunate to find this lovely bed and breakfast on our first visit to Victoria. The innkeepers were very attentive to our needs and were quite helpful when we were planning our daily activities. We also appreciated their suggestions for good restaurants and then their making the necessary reservations for us. The room in which we stayed was very quiet, comfortable and luxurious. The four-course gourmet breakfasts were delicious as well as beautiful. What an indulgence to top off a shrimp and asparagus crepe with a rich creme brulee---we were so well-fed we usually skipped lunch!
reviews.title: Wonderful Ambrosia experience

likes.liked: — Small inn, great breakfasts, quiet location

reviews.text: The attention to detail at the Ambrosia was impressive, including the coffee, tea and fresh cookies which were always available, the very fine bath products and the comfy robes and slippers. Gae and Gavin were so welcoming and charming---we will look forward to staying there again on our next visit to Victoria.
reviews.title: Gracious hosts at the Ambrosia B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had the good fortune to stay at the Ambrosia Historic Bed & Breakfast Retreat during our stay in Victoria, BC. Gavin and Gae were our most gracious hosts who provided a warm welcome, luxurious accomodations, as well as, the most amazing breakfasts that sustained us until dinner. Being a vegan, I do not usually partake in the breakfast offered my most B&B's as they generally offer good but tradional meals. Gavin and Gae went to alot of trouble to provide me with a delicious and nourishing vegan breakfast. They were attentive to every detail right down to the vegan chocolate bar that was left on the pillow. My husband and I highly recommend this wonderful Bed & Breakfast.
reviews.title: A Wonderful, Peaceful Retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent 4 course breakfast - I am usually full by the 3rd course but everything tastes so good and well presented with such great effort and service, I was compelled to finish it all. First course is some kind of fruit dish - fruits with yogurt or cooked pear with yogurt or cooked grape-fruit. All very yummy, 2nd course would usu be some kind of bread - crunchy warm croissant or bread with grains and a fluffy name. 3rd course would be the main like crepes, or egg benedict with cheese, yum yum....4th would be dessert that is outta this world!!! And the tea, wow, a huge selection of nice tea (i'm a tea person so I didn't try the coffee but I'll bet it's good too!!!) In short, it's the best kind of breakfast ever, fit for a king and queen. I was so stuffed I would usu have a late lunch or skip lunch altogether.
reviews.title: The best bed and breakfast ever!
Cozy in Canada!
reviews.text: As for the bed - it's really comfy. I've slept in many 5 star (or so called 6 star, ie the best) hotels all over the world and I'd say the Zen bed is almost as comfy as those posh places I've stayed in. The jet tub was fabulous too - our hosts provided us with AVEDA bathing salts - details that just make the whole stay fantastic. The Zen room is on the 2nd floor with the windows facing the street, but that's not a problem as the street is mostly quiet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only down side is the lack of TV (TV addict here) and internet station (there's wifi, but we didn't bring our pda nor laptop) but there's a shelf of books with good range of bestsellers and non-fiction. And hot water with basket of tea and coffee just outside the room. There's some CDs provided (Jazz/Yoga/Vocal) with a CD player.
reviews.title: 5 Star B&B, 5 Star Service

likes.liked: — The welcoming feeling we received as soon as we walked in the door and the beautiful home itself
likes.disliked: — There was NOTHING to not like....wish we could have stayed longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two thumbs up for this B&B with very nice and friendly hosts!!!
reviews.title: Ambrosia on our Minds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ambrosia Bed and Breakfast for our honeymoon and it was amazing. The room was beautiful and cozy and the house was wonderful. We stayed in the Ambrosia Room with the giant jetted bath. The house was close to town so it was easy to walk anywhere. The owners were extraordinarialy helpful and the breakfast in the morning was unbelievable. This was the perfect romantic setting for us to start our life together!
reviews.title: Charm, comfort, and style

likes.liked: — Charming, intimate setting in a beautifully restored Victorian and fantastic gourmet breakfast
likes.disliked: — None of the furnishings were gilded in pure gold (I can't think of one real complaint...honostly!)

description: Our fabulous 5 star rated historic retreat in downtown Victoria is close to Victoria's inner harbour, Beacon Hill Park and St. Anne's Academy. King and queen accommodation, jetted tubs for two, rain showers, heated floors, luxurious feather beds and down duvets, and fireplaces. We offer a multiple course, gourmet breakfast, Aveda salon amenities, Frette linens & towels and the finest concierge service. We customize proposals, honeymoons, anniversaries and romantic getaway weekends.
